text: José Omar Perdomo Machado (born 3 July 1993) is a Spanish footballer who plays for San Fernando CD as a winger. ==Club career== Born in Las Palmas, Canary Islands, Perdomo graduated with Universidad de Las Palmas CF's youth setup, and made his senior debuts in the 2010–11 campaign, in Segunda División B. In the 2011 summer he moved to UD Las Palmas, returning to youth football. After representing the latter's C and B-sides, Perdomo moved to CF Unión Viera in 2013.El Unión Viera se pone en marcha dispuesto a repetir los éxitos (Unión Viera starts working hoping to repeat the success); La Provincia, 24 July 2013 After scoring 11 goals for the club he joined Atlético Madrid in January 2014, being assigned to the C-team also in the fourth level.Omar ficha por el Atlético B (Omar signs for Atlético B); El Mundo Deportivo, 23 January 2014 In the 2014 summer Perdomo signed for Estrella CF, but on 22 January 2015, joined another reserve team, CD Tenerife B in the fourth division.El Tenerife B se refuerza para la segunda vuelta (Tenerife B bolsters for the second turn); DeporPress, 22 January 2015 He made his first team debut for the latter on 10 May, coming on as a late substitute for Javi Moyano in a 0–1 away loss against Racing de Santander for the Segunda División championship.Triunfo de oro en El Sardinero (Golden triumph at El Sardinero); Marca, 10 May 2015 Perdomo scored his first professional goal on 25 October 2015, netting his team's first in a 2–2 home draw against CA Osasuna.El Tenerife, con nueve, logró rescatar un punto ante Osasuna (Tenerife, with nine men, rescued a point against Osasuna); Marca, 25 October 2015 The following 1 April he renewed his contract until 2018, being definitely promoted to the main squad.El Tenerife cierra la renovación de Omar Perdomo hasta junio de 2018 (Tenerife complete the renewal of Omar Perdomo until June 2018); Mundo Deportivo, 1 April 2016 On 13 July 2017, Perdomo was loaned to fellow second tier club Gimnàstic de Tarragona for one year, with a permanent three-year deal subsequently arranged.Omar Perdomo, cedido al Nàstic de Tarragona (Omar Perdomo, loaned to Nàstic de Tarragona); CD Tenerife, 13 July 2017 The following 6 June, it was announced that Tenerife opted against his return, and he signed for Nàstic permanently.El Tenerife no ejerce la opción de repescar a Omar Perdomo (Tenerife do not execute the option to bring back Omar Perdomo); Mundo Deportivo, 6 June 2018 On 31 January 2019, Perdomo signed for third division side UD Ibiza after terminating his contract with the Catalans. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Las Palmas de Gran Canaria Category:Spanish footballers Category:Association football wingers Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:Divisiones Regionales de Fútbol players Category:Universidad de Las Palmas CF footballers Category:UD Las Palmas C players Category:UD Las Palmas Atlético players Category:Atlético Madrid C players Category:CD Tenerife B players Category:CD Tenerife players Category:Gimnàstic de Tarragona footballers Category:UD Ibiza players Category:San Fernando CD players
title: Omar Perdomo
